page.title: 15Stalking at Kylestrome
page.content: During the shooting season the stalker collects the owner's guests at 10.30 a.m. and sets off in the boat to Glendhu. From here he walks out the hill while the guests go out on the ponies, led up by the gillies. When the stalker sees a suitable deer,_ one aged between 6 and 10 years old or between 12 and 14st. in weight, his work really begins. He has to bring the guest in as close as possible to the deer. Keeping the wind in their faces and using rocks and bushes as cover, they move in to within 100 yards. Then the guest takes the rifle to try his shot. If he kills the deer, the gillie takes the carcass back to the boat. The stalker goes off again to look for more animals. Our stalker thoroughly enjoys his work, but his greatest pleasure is going off alone to enjoy the peace of the hills.
